title: Any tips for a pretty good lvl 16?
body:
Hey,

I'm starting to get K/D/A such as 12/0/6. I believe that's a pretty damn good score. I usually play Wukong, Kennen or Akali. 
Any tips to improve my score?

Thanks,
CarbonMini{{champion:85}} {{champion:62}}

replies.body: Score doesn't win games, objectives do. Upvote this so all the bronzies can get this into their head.

True.
But if there's a score that matters, it's creep score, not KDA.
Try to perfect your farming, it's worth a lot more money than kills ;)
Doesn't matter if you have 300 CS and suck at the game. All about teamwork and objectives.
Well, if you get 300cs at 20mins you're probably at their inhib anyways.

Hey,
Oooh... This became a level 30 chat room! I have never, ever got more than 250 cs at the end in my whole life.
I'll work on it!
CarbonMini

Umm well to start essence reaver on kennen please don't build that on kennen ever again. Now to get down to business from your match history you need a lot of learning i.e itemisation and reading passives and what items are used for melee/ranged champions ( ravenous hydra kennen don't do it). You need some practice you need to learn what to build and when to build it and cs;ing in lane, you obviously know how to get kills but getting cs and doing so is where you need to improve try to I'm for at least 120 cs @20 mins without getting killed or killing then add in the killing part and achieve both then try to set a personal best for most kills and most cs @ 20mins .

Hey, 
Thanks for the advice. No essence reaver on Kennen it shall be!
Thanks
CarbonMini

- Try to improve your last hitting. 20 or so minion kills will give you the same gold as a champion kill and this will be your main source of money once you start playing against better opponents who you can't kill as easily.

- Make sure you're building the right items. Some of your builds are a bit questionable, and you'd likely do better if you bought more efficient stuff on the champs you're playing. Check out probuilds or a similar site for a better idea on this.

- Try to get a couple of rune pages made once you unlock the good runes (at level 20 i think?), one for AD and one for AP is a good start. You will be at a disadvantage if you dont have decent runes, as they make quite a difference in early fights.

Hey,
20 Minion kills = champion kill? Wow! No wonder why enemy champs who have like 200+ cs destroy me in 1v1.
Thanks
CarbonMini

Good job mate, and welcome to the community! :) 

Best thing you can do is stay positive. You're doing well, and that is excellent, but things will get a little harder as you approach 30. One of the reasons for this are you'll be up against people who are 30 and have access to lovely runes. Chances are, since you're doing well, you'll also be matched against people who are as fortunate. You'll see more of the toxic people once you're 30, but the best thing to do is keep positive and don't worry too much about individual games. Worry more about what you learn from those games, and how you can improve. 

All in all, get a heap of practice in Normals before you move into Ranked gameplay. Try to learn each of the roles in the meta, at the very least you will need to know how to support. Sounds like you're off to a good start, good luck!

Hey,
Last week, I used to get positive K/D/A s. Now that I'm versing harder people, (you mentioned it) I am getting challenged every time. LoL became more enjoyable, actually. I had so much fun playing Sion. (His ult :) Now I'm getting something like 6/4/3 in good games and 0/7/4 in REALLY bad games. I will take your advice and hopefully, one day, I'll meet you on the Summoner's Rift!
Thanks
CarbonMini

Don't rush into high level games as soon as you feel like you want to... I ran straight into ranked when I hit 30 bc I had 136 wins ( thought that was great when I kept getting 8 winning streaks ect) and I got crushed, no good runes, no strategy and no team play. When you start to progress into the higher echelons of play (26 and above based on your probable mmr atm) it stops becoming a mindless kill fest, I watched a friend smurf (he is platinum 4 atm) against people in bronze (not a great comparison to you I know but I hope you catch my meaning) he went lee sin jg and did ok (7/4 at the end), the enemy sion in top was 16/5 by 20 minutes and very very tanky. He was crushing everyone and they couldn't face him down (mostly because they couldn't figure out how) but lee sin at 35 minutes turned around a losing fight against him (1v1) and the sion shat his pants and ran (and died). He thought he was unstoppable at first just because of his score, what he should have done is grouped with his team and focused turrets and squishes. They lost... As I said before its is not a mindless kill fest to victory, your score can be an eyesore but you can still carry and in the end all that matters is the win.

Now, one other thing
No matter how good you are don't brag because there is someone who will be better then you (in your peer group)

Hey,
Sorry for showing-off. I wasn't meant to show off... Yeah. You get the point right?
CarbonMini

Hey,
Thanks so much for the advice you guys have given me!
I will work on a new build, and try getting some runes when I'm lvl 20! (Im now lvl 18)
I'll practice last hitting, and I have to practice jungling too. I do this with Cho.
I'm just right now shocked that the LoL community would be this helpful.
Thanks alot!
CarbonMini

"focus on objectives instead of kills"
next minute he suicides to die for a tower he would've gotten regardless...

true story is.... if you want to climb elo you need to play aggressively and get fed, how do you do that? you pick the right champion, you learn them, you learn to cs, you learn to roam, you learn to map awareness, and ofc you learn to ward... in some cases you need to properly itemize... oh and decision making is what separates diamond from plat, golds also have superior decision making to bronze/silver... not much of a surprise I hope..
and if you are stuck in bronze 3/4/5 it means you have awful decision making, terrible mechanics, awful map awareness, and so forth... 

let's say you are a shen.. you have no lifesteal items, only a q... so would spirit visage mean much? no.. would a bansheeis work a lot better? depends on their team, if they have a thresh/blitz/lb/ahri, etc.. sure 

always remember, losing an objective for the greater objective means nothing.... roam bot > 3 kills > tower > dragon

Last hitting minions is the best thing to learn

Focus on objectives over kills

Make sure you adapt your build to the situation.

Make sure you know how to play every role effectively, and find at least three champions in each you are good at.
Start trying to focus on cs and last hitting
